title: How To Make Healthy Choices When Eating Out
summary: Casual chain restaurants such as Outback Steakhouse, Chili's or Applebee’s are generally the best bet for people eating a balanced diet. If you have dietary restrictions, be sure to communicate them to your server. Commit to ordering a vegetable side dish, such as broccoli or green beans, to help keep your meal balanced. Don’t be afraid to order a smaller portion of your main dish instead of having a baked potato instead of the baked potato with butter and sour cream.

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Know The Basics Before Going Out To Eat"),mdx("p",null,`Before heading out to try some of the best restaurants in your area, it\u2019s important to know some key facts. This will help you identify the dishes and menu options that are best suited to your dietary needs.
First, you\u2019ll want to consider the type of establishment you\u2019re going to. Casual chain restaurants such as Outback Steakhouse, Chili\u2019s or Applebee\u2019s are generally the best bet for people eating a balanced diet. They\u2019re usually family-friendly and have plenty of options that suit most dietary needs, including special menus for vegetarians, vegans and those with gluten intolerance or allergies.
You also want to make sure you check the hours of operation before leaving the house. This is especially important if you\u2019re meeting friends or colleagues for happy hour or late night. Most casual restaurants are open until the late evening, but some only serve breakfast or lunch.`),mdx("h2",null,"Plan Ahead"),mdx("p",null,`Before heading out to eat, make sure to plan ahead. This will help you avoid making poor choices at the restaurant, which can often lead to over-eating.
If possible, visit the restaurant ahead of time to scope out the menu and decide what you\u2019ll order. If you\u2019re in a rush, you can also check out the menu online before you go.`),mdx("p",null,"If you have dietary restrictions, be sure to communicate them to your server. This will help avoid problems when it comes time to place your order."),mdx("h2",null,"Select The Right Restaurant"),mdx("p",null,"If you have dietary restrictions, you may need to be a little more picky about which restaurants you choose to eat at. Don\u2019t worry, though; there are plenty of options. If you\u2019re not sure where to start, consider the following factors. Atmosphere - While this may not be a major consideration if you\u2019re eating solo, or with close friends or family, it can be helpful when you\u2019re meeting clients or colleagues for business meals. A quiet and casual atmosphere is often best. If you\u2019re looking for a place that\u2019s lively and has a fun vibe, though, you\u2019ll want to find a restaurant that\u2019s a little noisier. Location - You\u2019ll want to consider where the restaurant is located. If you\u2019re meeting clients, or want to be close to work, try to find a place that\u2019s centrally located. If you\u2019re going out with friends, though, you may be better off eating at a restaurant that\u2019s farther away, so you have time to relax, enjoy your food and not have to rush back to the office."),mdx("h2",null,"Watch (and ask) What Goes Into Your Food"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re curious about how a certain dish is made, or how the chef prepares your seafood or meat, feel free to ask. In fact, many chefs and servers are happy to provide details about the ingredients they use and how they\u2019re prepared.
When ordering salmon, for example, you may notice that it\u2019s grilled, not baked. If you\u2019re worried about potential toxins in the grilled salmon, you can ask your server about the salmon\u2019s preparation and whether it was cooked in healthy oils.`),mdx("p",null,"Similarly, if you\u2019re ordering a salad, you may be concerned about whether the dressing is made with sugar or high fructose corn syrup. If so, feel free to ask the server about it."),mdx("h2",null,"Commit To A Healthy Side Dish Or Vegetable"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re ordering a meal that doesn\u2019t come with a side dish or vegetable, it\u2019s easy to go off-course nutritionally.
To help keep your meal balanced, commit to ordering a vegetable side dish, such as broccoli or green beans. This can also help you avoid the dreaded \u201CClean plate club\u201D (i.e., eating so much of your main dish that there\u2019s nothing left on your plate).`),mdx("p",null,"Also, don\u2019t be afraid to ask for a smaller portion of your main dish, such as having a baked potato instead of the baked potato with butter and sour cream combo."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t Be Afraid Of The Fresh Produce And Lean Proteins"),mdx("p",null,`Many restaurants offer large salads and some offer baked potatoes as healthy alternatives to French fries. If you\u2019re not a salad person, though, don\u2019t feel obliged to order one as a side dish.
Instead, try to order fresh fruit as a dessert and commit to a baked potato as your side dish. If you\u2019re not sure what to order, look for protein- and fiber-rich foods such as grilled chicken, salmon, beans, quinoa, brown rice and vegetables.`),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re concerned about overeating, or if you\u2019re just trying to avoid eating too many calories, be careful when choosing baked potatoes. Although baked potatoes certainly have their place as a healthy meal option, they can also be very high in calories."),mdx("h2",null,"Take Home Leftovers"),mdx("p",null,`Whilst eating out is great, having a few work lunches a week can be expensive, not to mention the health implications of consuming so much processed food and sodium.
If it\u2019s possible, take a little time to pack up a delicious and healthy lunch to take to work. This will help you avoid the temptation of ordering unhealthy options at the local meal chain, as well as save a little money.`),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re taking leftovers to work, remember to keep them at an appropriate temperature. This will help you avoid food poisoning and the dreaded stomach ache."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,`Eating out can be a fun and social experience, but it\u2019s important to be mindful of your dietary needs when doing so.
By paying attention to the basics, such as the type of restaurant you\u2019re eating at, and watching what goes into your food, you\u2019ll be able to make healthy choices that support your diet and lifestyle goals while enjoying yourself at the same time.`),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re eating out with friends or family, you may find it helpful to bring along a few snack suggestions, such as nuts, dried fruit, apples or carrots. This can help you avoid cravings for unhealthy options and keep you energized throughout the day."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Your Home a Haven

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Creating a home is something that we all strive to achieve. For most, this is somewhere to relax and unwind after a hard day\u2019s work. It also needs to be somewhere that feels safe, somewhere where we can shut out the troubles of the world and just be ourselves. Creating a home is no easy feat though, especially when you consider all the things you need to consider from furnishing, decorating and creating spaces that feel like ours. That being said, creating your perfect home doesn\u2019t have to be as difficult as it sounds. There are plenty of ways in which you can make your home your own personal haven. Below are some tips on how you can transform your home into your very own haven..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Way to Start Your Day - With a Healthy Morning Routine

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In a world that moves as fast as ours, it can be easy to get caught up in the daily hustle and forget about the little things. But those little things are what make all the difference in the end. Take morning routines, for example. They may not seem like much on their own, but they have the power to make or break your day from start to finish.
With so many different morning routines out there, it can be difficult to know which one is right for you. There are those that are super long and involved, and others that are much shorter and simpler. Whether you\u2019re looking for something simple or something a little more intense, we\u2019ve got you covered with this ultimate guide on how to start your day with a healthy routine.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Make Your Commute Less Stressful

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think about your daily commute, it probably doesn\u2019t strike you as being particularly stressful. In fact, many people see their daily drive to work or school as a time for peace and quiet. After all, what could possibly be stressful about getting from point A to point B?
It\u2019s true that your commute isn\u2019t inherently stressful. In theory, it\u2019s just a short period of time each day when you go from home to work (or vise versa). But even the most seemingly insignificant details can make a big difference. Read on to learn more about how you can reduce stress during your commute and get to work happier every day!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Top Health Benefits of Meditation and How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Meditation is one of the most effective ways to bring your mind and body back into balance. This ancient practice has been proven to help decrease stress, anxiety and depression, while also improving memory and concentration. In addition to these benefits, research shows that meditation can also have a positive impact on your immune system, blood pressure and heart health by lowering your levels of the stress hormone cortisol and lifting your levels of oxytocin (a \u201Clove hormone\u201D).
In this article, we take a look at some of the top health benefits of meditation and how you can get started today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Tips for Keeping Your Hair Healthy and Strong

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Keeping your hair healthy can be a challenge at times, but it's important to keep on top of things in order to prevent any further damage. Whether you have fine and sensitive locks or thick and curly tresses, the right routine will help keep your hair strong and prevent it from breaking under pressure. Keeping your hair strong is an ongoing process, but by adopting some simple tips you can make things much easier on your locks long term.
Learn how to avoid over-washing, what products are best for stronger hair, as well as what you should be doing if you see strands falling out more than normal. The latter might seem strange, but trust us: sooner rather than later that excess hair loss could indicate something more serious happening beneath the surface. Here are 10 ways to keep your hair healthy and strong...`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Healthy Diet - And How to Stick to It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`A healthy diet is a significant part of any healthy lifestyle. It\u2019s also one of the most difficult to maintain. With all the tempting fast food, vending machine snacks, and restaurants with cheap but high-calorie meals, it\u2019s not easy to eat right. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to make sticking to a healthy diet easier.
If you want to improve your health, increase your energy, and lose weight\u2014while still enjoying great food\u2014a healthy diet is the way to do it. A healthy diet can help prevent disease and keep you feeling great. Following these tips can get you well on your way towards meeting your nutrition goals and eating a balanced diet that will keep you happy and healthy for life.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Plant-Based Foods for Optimal Health

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You\u2019ve probably heard it before: When you\u2019re busy, you need healthy snacks to keep you going. The problem is that it\u2019s not always easy to find healthy snacks that are also fast and convenient. In our hectic, on-the-go world, most of us don\u2019t have time to sit down for a healthy meal three times a day. Instead, we\u2019re often forced to make snap decisions about what we can eat quickly and conveniently. Unfortunately, those decisions too often lead to less than healthy snack options like potato chips or sweets. However, there are plenty of great ways to get your recommended daily intake of fruits and veggies even when you\u2019re on the go. These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go are perfect for keeping in your purse, desk drawer, locker, or anywhere else you might find yourself hungry and without access to a full meal."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Yourself When You Have a Busy Schedule

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you someone who is known to be a selfless person? Do you often place the needs of others before your own? If so, you\u2019re definitely an amazing person. However, when it comes to your social life and personal interests, do those aspects take a backseat most of the time? Whether you come from a hectic work schedule or have other obligations that require your attention most of the time, being busy all the time can completely suck the life out of you.
If that sounds like you, don\u2019t worry! You aren\u2019t alone. Many people today find it difficult to carve out some time for themselves. Thankfully, it is possible to balance a busy schedule and make time for yourself. Here are some helpful suggestions on how you can make time for yourself even when you feel like there isn\u2019t any left in the world.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Create a Healthy Grocery List on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you\u2019re on a tight budget, it can feel like hitting up the grocery store is one of the last things you can afford to do. However, there are ways to make your food dollars go further and still eat well.
Instead of making weekly trips to multiple stores and markets, plan a shopping day and hit one store at a time. Look for sales in that store before you go and stock up on foods that are good value. You might even consider investing in a membership card or becoming an insider or club member so you get vouchers or other discounts. Adding your own spin on some classic cheap meals will also help you save money without sacrificing nutrition. It just takes some planning and research to make it work!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
